title: Lesson 18: I Will Love Others
content: To prepare yourself spiritually to teach this lesson, please read and ponder the following:
Loving others, even those who may be different from us, is one of the most important ways we can follow the Savior Jesus Christ (see
). We show our love for others by being kind to them, listening to them, comforting them, and serving them. (See

Our privilege is to serve as instruments through whom the Holy Ghost can teach, testify, comfort, and inspire. We should therefore become worthy to receive the Spirit. … As you prepare yourself spiritually and acknowledge the Lord in your teaching, you will become an instrument in His hands. When your heart is filled with love,

Use the scriptures as you teach the children. When you tell a story from the scriptures, point to the place in the scriptures where the story is found. Teach the children to appreciate and reverence the scriptures.

Display the picture of the good Samaritan on page 78. Open the Bible and tell the children that you are going to share a story Jesus told about loving others. Using simple language, tell the story of the good Samaritan. Below is an example:
One day there was a man who was lying on the ground
(point to the injured man in the picture).
He was hurt. Two men walked by. They saw him, but they did not help. A third man came
(point to the good Samaritan in the picture).
He saw the man lying on the ground, and he helped him. He showed love.
Tell the children that Jesus said we should show love too. Invite them to go on a pretend walk, and give them opportunities to pretend to show love for others. For example:
Look, there’s a friend who fell down. Let’s help our friend stand up
(pretend to help the friend stand up).
Let’s keep walking. We see a friend who is thirsty. Let’s give our friend a drink of water
Let’s keep walking. We see our mommy and daddy. Let’s give them a hug and say, “I love you”
Smile as you tell the children you love them. Look in their eyes. Your facial expressions and your actions will tell the children even more than your words do.
Sincerely tell the children that you love them. Tell them how happy you feel when you show love for others.
Invite a child to give the closing prayer.

so that you can turn to it easily.
For the coloring activity and the heart activity:
Copy the illustration for each child to color.
Tell the children that we learn in the scriptures that Jesus taught us to love one another. Read
and do the actions below. Invite the children to join you.

Young children may not be able to color within the lines. They may be interested only in making a mark or two on the page. Cheerfully comment on their efforts without asking them to color in a certain way. The purpose of the illustrations in this manual is to give the children a visual representation of the principles in the lesson.

Let the children color a copy of the illustration . While they are coloring, help them understand that we are all children of God and each one of us is special. Remind them that Heavenly Father and Jesus want us to love everyone.
Read the following examples (or create some of your own), and ask, “Does this show love?” After each example, have the children hold up their paper hearts and say, “Love.”
When you help someone who is hurt.
